You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
SALESFORCE FOR SLACK INTEGRATIONS
Run Einstein Discovery Predictions in Slack

Get Einstein Discovery predictions on records in your Lightning Reports—directly in Slack. Use the CRM Analytics for Slack app to run an Einstein Discovery model on the records in the report. The app returns the average prediction score, top-influencing factors, recommended actions, and the most at-risk records in the report. Share the predictions with your Slack channels and colleagues.

REQUIRED USER PERMISSIONS
USER PERMISSIONS
NEEDED
To use CRM Analytics for Slack:	

Connect Salesforce with Slack


To view Einstein Discovery predictions, improvements, and related details that are derived from the deployed model:	View Einstein Discovery Recommendations
NOTE Available on Lightning Reports based on a primary object with an Einstein Discovery binary classification or regression model deployed.

Prerequisites

A CRM Analytics Plus or Einstein Predictions license is required to access Einstein Discovery. See License and Permission Requirements for Einstein Discovery.

In CRM Analytics, create an Einstein Discovery story and deploy the model to a Salesforce object with all the fields mapped. See Deploy Models.

NOTE The CRM Analytics app uses the most recently deployed model on the object.

In Salesforce, create a report containing the records you want to analyze. The report must contain the record ID or name. Make sure the report’s primary object matches the object where the Einstein Discovery model is deployed. See Build a Report.

NOTE The prediction results use the first 2000 rows of the report.

Run Einstein Discovery Predictions in Slack

To view and share predictions in Slack:

In the CRM Analytics app for Slack, find the report and select Run Prediction in the action menu.
View results in the Predictions window. See the table for result descriptions.
Optionally, scroll down and click Share to collaborate directly in Slack.
RESULT	DESCRIPTION
Average Prediction Score	

The overall predicted likelihood to reach the outcome defined in the model, across the first 2000 records in the report.

In Einstein Discovery, a prediction is a derived value, produced by a model, that represents a possible future outcome. You can think of a prediction as the output of a predictive model that is based on the inputs of predictor variables that the model accepts.


Top Predictors	The conditions that most significantly drive the predicted outcome, in decreasing order of magnitude. A condition is a data value associated with a column. In Einstein Discovery, a predictor consists of one or two conditions.
How to Improve this Outcome	

Suggested action, based on prescriptive analytics, that a user can take to improve the likelihood of a desired outcome. Improvements are associated with actionable variables, which are explanatory variables that people can control. Taking a suggested action can improve the predicted outcome. An improvement is analogous to a prescription in prescriptive analytics.

Improvements are shown based on the model's actionable variables. Actionable variables are optional. If no actionable variables are configured, improvements aren’t shown in results.


Records Least Likely to Reach a Successful Outcome	

The records in the report with the strongest predicted likelihood to be unsuccessful, among the first 2000 records in the report. Success is based on the goal defined in the model.

Requires binary classification model.

SEE ALSO
Deploy Models

title: Integrate Salesforce with Slack for Analytics and Prediction
